lines.text: I used to think that all I wanted was the good opinion of honorable men and the ungrudging love of beautiful women. Now I know for sure that all I really want is a cigarette.
You just don't know writers. They'll use anything, anybody. They'll eat their own young.

I've not seriously doubted since that afternoon that any lie will receive almost instant corroboration, and almost instant collaboration, if the maintenance of it results in the public enjoyment of someone else's pain, someone else's humiliation.
they're not broody hens, they don't sit on their eggs. You know what they do?
What?
They break the shells straightaway and *fry* what's inside.
What's the loveliest word in the English language, officer? In the sound it makes in the mouth? In the shape it makes in the page? "E-L-B-O-W"
We're padding! Like a couple of bleeding sofas!
You must lie there all day, thinking of murdering people.
Yes. Yes, I do.
Into each life some rain must fall.
Metaphysics?
Music.
Why is it when you lose your health the entire medical profession takes it as axiomatic you've also lost your mind?
Why?... Why is it when you lose your health the entire medical profession takes it as axiomatic you also lost your mind!
Okay, okay bloody dog, me!
[he gives a cigarette to marlow who drags and coughs]
Good?
Good? Bloody marvellous!
Now listen to this. A purple passage.
No, a blue one, I hope.

There are songs to sing, there are feelings to feel, there are thoughts to think. That makes three things, and you can't do three things at the same time. The singing is easy, syrup in my mouth, and the thinking comes with the tune, so that leaves only the feelings. Am I right, or am I right? I can sing the singing. I can think the thinking. But you're not going to catch me feeling the feeling. No, sir.
Bastards. I'll wipe you out. Don't you know who I am? I'm the... I'm the Singing Detective!
I know it's an embarrassing question, even between husbands and wives, but what do you believe in?
Malthusianism.
Come again?
Malthus, but mandatory. Compulsory depopulation by infanticide, suicide, genocide or whatever other means suggest themselves. AIDS, for example, that'll do. Why should queers be so special?
I see.
vomit.
Short people shouldn't sit places where their feet don't touch the ground.
Can I go back to the ward now? I lead an exciting and vibrant life there.
I had on my best pajamas, the ones with red stripes and blue forget-me-nots. I was all dressed up and talcumed under the armpits; a million dollars was about to call. I was ready for it.
His throat's been cut!
I thought his voice sounded funny on the phone...
So, psychiatry's not nasty enough for you? You still want to get into literary criticism?
Money's not particularly one of my problems and I'll pay you well.
Oh, you don't know how much I want yet. And I'm not as cheap as I look.
I'm not paying you to make me feel small, am I?
Oh, you don't have to do that. That's thrown in without charge.
It's doing what we're told that makes us free.

[of nurses]
Like all morons with a mania for order, they put everything you really want exactly where you can't get at it.
You're cheap, Marlow.
Ten cents a dance, fella.
Mr Marlow, you can't deny I'm paying you good money...
Money, you're paying me money. Why put "good" in front of it? Who knows its virtue? I don't know where it's been. Do you?

[Doctors and nurses have been clustered round, discussing Marlow's condition while ignoring him]
How do you feel about trying one of the new retinoids? Hmm?
[pauses]
Do you understand the question?
Uh - no, I don't think so.

[slowly]
I'm asking you if you'd like to try one of the new...

I don't understand the question because I seem to have regressed into a helpless, pathetic condition of total dependency, of a kind normally associated with infancy. The last time I experienced anything remotely like this was in my bloody pram, being poked and drooled over by slobbering cretins, who turned out to be escapees from the local loony bin. They thought they were *doctors* and *nurses*!
[to Philip Marlowe, about to rub some ointment into his scaly skin]
I'll have to lift your penis now to grease around it.
No, that's murder.
